body_html: It doesn't make much sense to look at the size of libcaffe2.a, because it is just a collection of object files. They contain duplicates of the same symbols, and much debug information. The size you should be looking it is increase in the size of your shared library after you link libcaffe2.a: the linker will remove duplicate symbols, and can strip debug symbols.
body_text: It doesn't make much sense to look at the size of libcaffe2.a, because it is just a collection of object files. They contain duplicates of the same symbols, and much debug information. The size you should be looking it is increase in the size of your shared library after you link libcaffe2.a: the linker will remove duplicate symbols, and can strip debug symbols.
body: It doesn't make much sense to look at the size of `libcaffe2.a`, because it is just a collection of object files. They contain duplicates of the same symbols, and much debug information. The size you should be looking it is increase in the size of your shared library after you link `libcaffe2.a`: the linker will remove duplicate symbols, and can strip debug symbols.
